meanings.definition: To awaken from sleep or a state of inactivity.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise helped to arouse me from my deep slumber.
meanings.sent2: The smell of breakfast cooking in the kitchen will arouse anyone from sleep.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock did its job to arouse me from my peaceful dreams.
meanings.sent4: The sudden clap of thunder outside could arouse even the heaviest sleeper.
meanings.sent5: The chirping birds outside the window gently aroused me from my nap.

meanings.definition: To evoke a feeling or reaction.
meanings.sent1: The sad movie scene could arouse tears from the audience.
meanings.sent2: His speech was so moving that it could arouse strong emotions in anyone.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist in the story managed to arouse laughter from the readers.
meanings.sent4: Her heartfelt apology was enough to arouse forgiveness from her friend.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset never fails to arouse a sense of wonder in me.

meanings.sent1: The thrilling roller coaster ride could arouse excitement in even the most timid person.
meanings.sent2: The anticipation of the upcoming vacation was enough to arouse joy in the children.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks never failed to arouse amazement from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The delicious aroma of freshly baked cookies could arouse hunger in anyone passing by.
meanings.sent5: The energetic music always manages to arouse a desire to dance in the crowd.
